Event.0: Actress Billie Piper and fellow actor Laurence Fox divorce after 8 years of marriage
Event.1: Wenchuan earthquake, measuring 7.8 in magnitude occurs in Sichuan, China, killing over 87,000, injuring 374,643 and leaving homeless between 4.8 million and 11 million people
Event.2: A massive earthquake struck Sichuan province in China, causing great destruction and killing some 90,000 people.
Event.3: Model and actress Ali Landry divorces (30) "Saved by the Bell" actor Mario Lopez (30) due to infidelity only less than 2 weeks after getting married
Event.4: Former US President Jimmy Carter arrives in Cuba for a five-day visit with Fidel Castro becoming first President of the United States, in or out of office, to visit the island since Castro's 1959 revolution.
Event.5: "Pulp Fiction", directed by Quentin Tarantino and starring John Travolta, Uma Thurman and Samuel L. Jackson premieres at the Cannes Film Festival (Palme d'Or 1994)
Event.6:
Jonah Lomu
New Zealand rugby union football player
was born
Event.7: The British rock group the Rolling Stones released Exile on Main Street, a double album that is considered one of their defining works.
Event.8:
Tony Hawk
American skateboarder
was born
Event.9: "Are You Experienced" album by the Jimi Hendrix Experience first released - one of the most influential debut albums ever
Event.10: The Soviet Union lifted its blockade of Berlin.
Event.11: Axis forces in North Africa surrender
Event.12: Nazi blitzkrieg and conquest of France begins with the crossing of the Muese River
Event.13: King George VI of the United Kingdom was crowned following the abdication of Edward VIII.
Event.14:
George Carlin
American comedian
was born
Event.15:
Burt Bacharach
American songwriter and pianist
was born
Event.16:
First flight over the North Pole
Aboard the semirigid airship Norge, Norwegian explorer Roald Amundsen, American scientist Lincoln Ellsworth, and Italian engineer Umberto Nobile made the first undisputed flight over the North Pole on this day in 1926.
Event.17: American baseball player, manager, and coach Yogi Berra was born in St. Louis, Missouri.
Event.18: 1st recorded shutout in pro baseball, Chicago 1, St Louis 0
Event.19: French composer Gabriel Fauré was born in Pamiers, Ariège.
Event.20:
Florence Nightingale
British nurse, statistician, and social reformer
was born
Event.21: English nurse Florence Nightingale, who founded trained nursing as a profession for women, was born in Florence, Italy; International Nurses Day is celebrated on her birthday.
Event.22: William Wilberforce makes his first major speech on abolition in the UK House of Commons, reasoning the slave trade morally reprehensible and an issue of natural justice
Event.23: During the American Revolution, Maj. Gen. Benjamin Lincoln of the Continental Army was forced to surrender with 7,000 troops at Charleston, South Carolina.
Event.24: Founding Father of the United States Roger Sherman (42) weds second wife Rebecca Prescott (20)
Event.25: Prince Willem II of Orange (14) marries English princess Mary Henrietta Stuart (9)
Event.26: Richard I of England marries Berengaria of Navarre in Cyprus
